010package imagingbook.common.color.edge;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.atan2;
014import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
015
016import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
017import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
018import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
022import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
023
024/**
025 * Simple grayscale edge detector for color images. The color image
026 * is converted to grayscale for edge detection.
027 * 
028 * @author W. Burger
029 * @version 2014/02/17
030 * @version 2022/09/04 converted to implement interface
031 */
032public class GrayscaleEdgeDetector implements ColorEdgeDetector {
033
034        /**
035         * Currently unused, no parameters to set
036         */
037        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
038        }
039        
040        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
041        private final Parameters params;
042        private final int M;    // image width
043        private final int N;    // image height
044        private final FloatProcessor Emag;      // edge magnitude map
045        private final FloatProcessor Eort;      // edge orientation map
046        
047        // Sobel-kernels for x/y-derivatives:
048    private static final float[] HxS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[] {
049                        -1, 0, 1,
050                    -2, 0, 2,
051                    -1, 0, 1
052                    });
053    
054    private static final float[] HyS = Matrix.multiply(1.0f/8, new float[] {
055                        -1, -2, -1,
056                         0,  0,  0,
057                         1,  2,  1
058                         });
059    
060        public GrayscaleEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor I) {
061                this(I, new Parameters());
062        }
063        
064        public GrayscaleEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
065                this.params = params;
066                this.M = ip.getWidth();
067                this.N = ip.getHeight();
068                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
069                Eort = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
070                findEdges(ip);
071        }
072
073        private void findEdges(ImageProcessor ip) {
074                FloatProcessor I = (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) ?
075                                IjUtils.toFloatProcessor((ColorProcessor) ip) :
076                                ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
077                
078            FloatProcessor Ix = I;
079            FloatProcessor Iy = (FloatProcessor) Ix.duplicate();
080            
081            Convolver conv = new Convolver();
082                conv.setNormalize(false);
083                conv.convolve(Ix, HxS, 3, 3);
084                conv.convolve(Iy, HyS, 3, 3);
085                
086                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
087                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
088                                // extract the gradients of the R, G, B channels:
089                                double dx = Ix.getf(u, v);      
090                                double dy = Iy.getf(u, v);              
091                                
092                                // calculate local edge magnitude:
093                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) sqrt(sqr(dx) + sqr(dy)));       
094                                
095                                // calculate edge orientation for the maximum channel:
096                                Eort.setf(u, v, (float) atan2(dy, dx));
097                        }
098                }
099        }
100        
101        @Override
102        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
103                return Emag;
104        }
105
106        @Override
107        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
108                return Eort;
109        }
110        
111}
